meanings.definition: A large undulating mass of something, typically cloud, smoke, or steam.
meanings.sent1: The billows of smoke rose high into the sky.
meanings.sent2: The dark storm clouds formed billows above us.
meanings.sent3: The magician made shapes out of the billows of smoke.
meanings.sent4: The billows of steam from the kettle enveloped the room.
meanings.sent5: The billows of cloud looked like giant cotton candy in the sky.

meanings.definition: (of fabric) Fill with air and swell outwards.
meanings.sent1: The curtains billow in the breeze coming through the window.
meanings.sent2: The sails billow as the wind fills them, propelling the boat forward.
meanings.sent3: Her dress billowed out behind her as she ran through the field.
meanings.sent4: The flag billowed proudly in the wind atop the mountain.
meanings.sent5: The hot air balloon billowed as it slowly ascended into the sky.
